UI_visible_response: Li Shangfu was dismissed from his position as China's Defense Minister reportedly due to corruption probes, after he disappeared from public life for two months1. His dismissal occurred not long after another high-profile removal—Xi Jinping's foreign minister, Qin Gang—was also fired under secretive circumstances2. While the official reason points to corruption investigations, the specifics surrounding his sacking remain somewhat mysterious and tied to internal political dynamics.
traffic_visible_response: Li Shangfu was dismissed from his position as China's Defense Minister reportedly due to corruption probes, after he disappeared from public life for two months [[1]]. His dismissal occurred not long after another high-profile removal—Xi Jinping's foreign minister, Qin Gang—was also fired under secretive circumstances [[2]]. While the official reason points to corruption investigations, the specifics surrounding his sacking remain somewhat mysterious and tied to internal political dynamics.
